br.uff.midiacom.ana.connector
Class NCLCompoundCondition<T extends NCLElement,Ec extends NCLCondition,Es extends NCLStatement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>

All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLCondition<T,Ep,Er>, NCLElement<T>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLCompoundCondition<T extends NCLElement,Ec extends NCLCondition,Es extends NCLStatement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
extends ParamElement<T>
implements NCLCondition<T,Ep,Er>

Class that represents a connector compound condition.
This element defines the attributes:

  • operator - compound condition operator. This attribute is required.
  • delay - delay waited by the condition. This attribute is optional.

This element has as children the elements:
  • simpleCondition - element representing a connector condition. The compound condition can have none or several condition elements.
  • compundCondition - element representing a connector condition. The compound condition can have none or several condition elements.
  • assessmentStatement - element representing a connector statement. The compound condition can have none or several statement elements.
  • compundStatement - element representing a connector statement. The compound condition can have none or several statement elements.
Note that the compound condition must have at least two conditions or statements.

setOperator

public void setOperator(NCLConditionOperator operator)
                 throws XMLException
Sets the compound condition operator. This attribute is required and can not be set to null.
The operator attribute relates the compound condition children elements. Its possible values are "and" and "or" and are defined in the enumeration NCLConditionOperator.
Using an "and" operator means that all conditions of the compound condition must be satisfied at the same time. Using an "or" operator means at least one condition of the compound condition must be satisfied.

Parameters:
operator - element representing the compound condition operator from the enumeration NCLConditionOperator.
Throws:
XMLException - if the element representing the operator is null.

getOperator

public NCLConditionOperator getOperator()
Returns the compound condition operator or null if the attribute is not defined.
The operator attribute relates the compound condition children elements. Its possible values are "and" and "or" and are defined in the enumeration NCLConditionOperator.
Using an "and" operator means that all conditions of the compound condition must be satisfied at the same time. Using an "or" operator means at least one condition of the compound condition must be satisfied.

Returns:
element representing the compound condition operator from the enumeration NCLConditionOperator or null if the attribute is not defined.

setDelay

public void setDelay(java.lang.Object delay)
              throws XMLException
Description copied from interface: NCLCondition
Sets the delay waited by the condition. This attribute is optional. Set the delay to null to erase a delay already defined.
The delay can be set as a parameter, in which case its value is defined by the link that uses the connector where this condition is.
In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Specified by:
setDelay in interface NCLCondition<T extends NCLElement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
Parameters:
delay - double, string or connector parameter representing the delay or null to erase a delay already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if an error occur while creating the delay value.

Returns the delay waited by the condition or null if the attribute is not defined.
The delay can be set as a parameter, in which case its value is defined by the link that uses the connector where this condition is.
In case the attribute value is defined by a parameter, the parameter must be defined in the same connector where this attribute assessment it.

Specified by:
getDelay in interface NCLCondition<T extends NCLElement,Ep extends NCLConnectorParam,Er extends NCLRoleElement>
Returns:
double, string or connector parameter representing the delay or null if the attribute is not defined.
